articles.title: DPRK's Acrobatic Stunt "Flying Girls" Wins Prize for First Place
articles.content:
DPRK's Acrobatic Stunt "Flying Girls" Wins Prize for First Place
Pyongyang, January 13 (KCNA) -- The prize for the first place went to the DPRK's acrobatic stunt "Flying Girls" at the 28th International "Golden Circus" Festival.
					The festival took place in Rome from Dec. 23 last year to Jan. 8 this year.
					
					Various prizes were conferred on DPRK acrobatic numbers.
					
					Technique prize of the festival went to "duo swing", its art prize to "equilibristic stunt" and Rome City Prize to "hand skill".
					
					The festival brought together famous acrobats from 8 countries including the DPRK, Russia, Cuba, Ukraine, Mongolia and Canada. 
					
					In the meantime, a squad of the Pyongyang Circus participated in the international joint circus in Spain from Dec. 3 last year to Jan. 8 this year.

articles.title: Phenomena Witnessed in Mourning Days (4) Unusual Glow over Jong Il Peak
articles.content:
Phenomena Witnessed in Mourning Days (4) Unusual Glow over Jong Il Peak
Pyongyang, January 13 (KCNA) -- Mysterious natural phenomena were observed in the Mt. Paektu area last December after the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					Around Janggun Peak, there were earth tremors for a few days from Dec. 16 before an unusual glow was seen over Jong Il Peak at around 17:30 on Dec. 19.
					
					People who have lived long in the area said they had never seen such a crimson glow.
					
					They also said the glow looked as if a red flag was unfolded over the peak to remind one of Kim Jong Il's life.

articles.title: Kim Hyong Gwon, Indomitable Revolutionary Fighter
articles.content:
Kim Hyong Gwon, Indomitable Revolutionary Fighter
Pyongyang, January 13 (KCNA) -- Kim Hyong Gwon was an indomitable revolutionary fighter who was active in the early period of the Korean revolution.
					He, an officer of the Korean Revolutionary Army, devotedly fought to implement President Kim Il Sung's plan to expand the armed struggle into the homeland.
					
					He became famous with the Phabal-ri incident.
					
					In August Juche 19 (1930), he led an armed group to Phabal-ri, Phungsan County, Korea and shot to death a Japanese police sergeant.
					
					His gun report that day reflected his resolution to devotedly implement the line of the President on the armed struggle.
					
					In front of the police post, he called upon all people loving the country to take up arms and fight against the Japanese imperialists.
					
					His group then went deep into the homeland to conduct bold military and political activities.
					
					He proved with his undaunted struggle in prison and heroic death the truth that a revolutionary should not stop fighting to implement the plan and intention of the President even in the worst situation.
					
					Arrested by a renegade's act of perfidy, Kim Hyong Gwon was subjected to medieval tortures, appeasement and delusion. But he remained true to his faith and principle and educated other prisoners in the line and policy of the President.
					
					He passed away in prison on January 12, 1936 at the age of 30, asking other prisoners to let the President know that his group never yielded to the Japanese imperialists. 
					
					Kim Hyong Gwon's was a brilliant life of a revolutionary faithful to the President.

articles.title: DPRK Farms Introduce Advanced Production System
articles.content:
DPRK Farms Introduce Advanced Production System
Pyongyang, January 13 (KCNA) -- Cooperative farms in the DPRK are now paying efforts to introducing the cyclic production system and the organic farming method in response to the call of the joint New Year editorial.
					Choe Hyon Su, a department director of the Ministry of Agriculture, told KCNA that modern stockbreeding bases have appeared in all parts of the country, providing good conditions of cyclic production between farming and stockbreeding.
					
					"Organic compound fertilizer factories are keeping the production going on a high level," he said, and went on:
					
					"Many farms have introduced advanced farming methods and techniques, like weeding and manuring rice fields with mud snails and preventing crop damage by blight and insects with biopesticide. 
					
					The Taedonggang Combined Fruit Farm and other fruit farms have benefited much from the cyclic production system in the fruit production.
					
					The Taedonggang Pig Farm produces large quantities of organic fertilizers, increasing the fertility of orchards.
					
					The Migok Cooperative Farm in Sariwon City, Jangsan Cooperative Farm in Ryongchon County and many other farms in the country have also produced organic fertilizers extensively.
					
					The farms owe their achievements to the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il, who had always paid deep concern to the development of agriculture.
					
					The officials in the field of agriculture are determined to boost grain output with the help of the cyclic production system between farming and stockbreeding and organic farming method."

articles.title: Aeguk Stone Work Factory
articles.content:
Aeguk Stone Work Factory
Pyongyang, January 13 (KCNA) -- The Aeguk Stone Work Factory has put spurs to production in hearty response to the joint calls of the Central Committee and Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK), which were released on December 31 last year.   
					The joint calls say, "Mass-produce beautifully dressed stones of high quality!"
					
					Located on the west coast, the factory boasts of large deposits of raw materials.
					
					Granite mined there so far is no more than the tip of an iceberg.
					
					The factory, equipped with up-to-date stone processing machines, has a great capacity of developing new products.
					
					All the production processes, including the granite processing process, are streamlined, controlled by computers.
					
					Stones broken in mining and processing are crushed into gravel and sand.
					
					Processed stones of diverse patterns and beautiful colors are in great demand in the construction sector of the country.
					
					Little distant from a port, it has a favorable condition for transportation. 
					
					Samples of various processed stones are displayed at the factory's exhibition for sale.
					
					Its products are also popular in foreign markets.

articles.title: White-bellied Black Woodpecker, Asset of Korea
articles.content:
White-bellied Black Woodpecker, Asset of Korea
Pyongyang, January 13 (KCNA) -- White-bellied black woodpecker has been protected and propagated in the DPRK as a precious asset of the country thanks to the government's policy of nature conservation.
					The bird, native to Korea, pricks holes more than 6.5 cm deep on chestnut, oak, pine-nut, pine and other big trees to hunt insects.
					
					The useful bird was firstly found in Kyonggi Province, Korea in summer of 1886. It was propagated in areas south of Mts. Songak and Chonma in Kaesong, Korea and Tsushima, Japan. With environment destroyed and people catching the bird at random, it totally disappeared in Japan around in October 1920. It was also hardly seen in Korea.
					
					President Kim Il Sung took measures in 1952, during the Fatherland Liberation War, to protect the bird from extermination and had the white-bellied black woodpecker in Mt. Songak in Kaesong listed as a national asset in 1956.
					
					An order of the Cabinet on protecting and propagating the bird and creating its reserves was adopted in September 1969. Reserves appeared in Phyongsan and Rinsan counties of North Hwanghae Province and Pongchon County of South Hwanghae Province.
					
					With reserves steadily increasing, the number of the bird has grown in the country.

articles.title: New Duck Farm Appears
articles.content:
New Duck Farm Appears
Pyongyang, January 13 (KCNA) -- A new duck farm was built on the bank of the River Chungman in Usi County, Jagang Province.
					The three-storied farm has computerized egg sterilization and hatching room, duck breed and reserve duck rooms and rooms for fattening duck.
					
					They are distributed in such a way as to raise pigs by use of duck excrement.
					
					It has also a feed processing room, feed store, cold storage, meat processing factory and other auxiliary buildings and a hostel for workers.
					
					There are also processes for producing fish food and composite microbial fertilizer and quality compost.
					
					The construction of the farm provided a foundation for mass-producing duck eggs and meat to make the diet of the county's population more affluent.

articles.title: Products of Sonhung Foodstuff Factory Become Popular in DPRK
articles.content:
Products of Sonhung Foodstuff Factory Become Popular in DPRK
Pyongyang, January 13 (KCNA) -- The Sonhung Foodstuff Factory in Pyongyang enjoys an increasing popularity in the DPRK for its quality products.
					The factory gained public favor at the Third Commodity Exhibition of Pyongyang Department Store No. 1 held some time ago.
					
					Its products attract many customers at the recently opened Kwangbok Area Supermarket, too.
					
					The factory supplies the supermarket with more than ten kinds of products like sweets, cakes, soft drinks, Eskimo pie and essential foodstuffs. 
					
					Kim Jong Sil, a 31-year-old woman living in Mangyongdae District, Pyongyang, told KCNA her children favor differently patterned sweets produced by the Sonhung Foodstuff Factory.

articles.title: Minju Joson Calls for Glorifying This Year with Successes in Light Industry
articles.content:
Minju Joson Calls for Glorifying This Year with Successes in Light Industry
Pyongyang, January 13 (KCNA) -- Minju Joson Friday in an editorial calls upon the officials and workers in the field of light industry to make this year a year when radical achievements are made in light industry and the people enjoy substantial benefit from this industry.
					They should speed up the brisk production drive for improvement of the people's standard of living, holding high the banner of the industrial revolution in the new century and the torch of Hamnam, true to the behests of leader Kim Jong Il, under the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un, the editorial stresses.
					
					It was the lifelong intention and wish of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il to turn the DPRK into a thriving socialist country with powerful national strength where everything prospers and people lead a rich and happy life without nothing to envy in the world, it says, and goes on:
					
					Today when the DPRK stands at the turning point of opening the gate to a thriving country, the light industrial factories across the country should mass-produce quality consumer goods for the people to enjoy their material and cultural life to the full.
					
					The sector of light industry should direct utmost concern to making the modern production bases, which are associated with the party's great care, pay off.
					
					It should produce in larger quantity goods which are welcomed by the people and have competitive power in world markets.
					
					The problem of raw and other materials for this sector should be solved by relying on domestic resources.
					
					It is needed to closely combine production with science and technology as required by the IT era in the new century and ensure strict localization of raw and other materials.
					
					A drive to lay productive and technical foundations of local industrial establishments should be conducted vigorously so as to update those establishments across the country.

articles.title: Disgusting Remarks of Minister of Unification of S. Korea under Fire
articles.content:
Disgusting Remarks of Minister of Unification of S. Korea under Fire
Pyongyang, January 13 (KCNA) -- Ryu U Ik, minister of Unification of south Korea, talked rubbish that he would "consult all the issues with the north irrespective of agenda," expressing regret at the firm stand of the DPRK. He blustered he was "urging a wise option and decision," impudently asserting "reform and opening are the only way for helping each other to survive and achieving co-prosperity and peaceful unification." 
					These reckless remarks come under fire by a bylined commentary of Rodong Sinmun Friday. 
					
					What he uttered is nothing but a shameless and cunning artifice to evade the responsibility for the collapse of the inter-Korean relations and mislead the public opinion, the commentary notes, and goes on: 
					
					Ryu let loose capricious remarks with forced smile in a bid to create impression that he will do something for north-south dialogue. But, it is too late now. 
					
					It is nonsensical to discuss the issue of destiny of the nation with heinous traitors to the nation. 
					
					Clear is the aim sought by Ryu in orchestrating a farce, lost to shame. His ulterior intention is to calm down protests of people at home and abroad against the treachery committed by the south Korean authorities during the mourning over the great loss to the nation and cover up their confrontation policy with a veil of "flexibility." 
					
					However, such cunning trickery of the Lee Myung Bak group can never work on the DPRK. The "pragmatism-veiled government" has already missed an opportunity to improve relations with the DPRK. There is nothing to expect from the Lee Myung Bak group. 
					
					The traitors would be well advised to stop playing such disgusting trick and wait for severe punishment by the nation.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak's Treacherous and Unethical Deeds Flailed
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak's Treacherous and Unethical Deeds Flailed
Pyongyang, January 13 (KCNA) -- Kim Hak Bok, chairman of the Kyoto Prefectural Headquarters of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan, on Wednesday made public a statement in denunciation of the treacherous and unethical deeds committed by the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors during the mourning over the great loss to the nation.
					The Lee group of south Korea unhesitatingly committed such unpardonable treasons as pointing guns at the compatriots in sorrow over the passing of the father of the nation and brutally repressing south Koreans' desire for mourning, the statement charged.
					
					It branded the group as the hideous confrontation maniacs that rubbed salt into the wounds of the nation in grief at the great loss.
					
					All the officials and compatriots under the headquarters are burning their hearts with the will not to pardon such treasons but surely force the Lee group to pay dearly for them, the statement said.
					
					It stressed the need to wipe out this group of traitors at once which is shame to the nation.
					
					The officials and compatriots under the headquarters will vigorously turn out in the nationwide struggle to smash the challenges of the anti-reunification forces and bring about a new phase for national reunification, the statement said.

articles.title: Probe into Scams Committed by Lee Myung Bak's Confidants Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Probe into Scams Committed by Lee Myung Bak's Confidants Demanded in S. Korea
Pyongyang, January 13 (KCNA) -- Kim Jin Phyo, floor leader of the Democratic United Party of south Korea, called for setting up a special headquarters under the Supreme Prosecutor's Office for investigation into the irregularities and corruption committed by confidants of Lee Myung Bak, according to south Korean MBC. 
					He said that there are more than 30 people involved in illegalities and corruption disclosed among confidants of Lee Myung Bak one after another, stressing the need to probe them to the last. 
					
					The "Grand National Party" has rejected the proposal of opposition parties to open a session of the "National Assembly" for introducing a law for special investigation to probe the truth behind the Ddos attack on the homepage of the Central Election Commission, he said, urging the GNP to reply for what fear it tries so hard to check the probe.

articles.title: S. Korea: Prosecution Arrests Internet User for Praising DPRK
articles.content:
S. Korea: Prosecution Arrests Internet User for Praising DPRK
Pyongyang, January 13 (KCNA) -- The puppet Suwon district prosecutor's office of south Korea on Wednesday walked off an Internet user before requesting a warrant of arrest for this person on charges of violation of the "National Security Law". 
					Such repression was imposed for the mere reason that the user posted articles praising the DPRK on Internet website.
					
					The south Korean authorities have cracked down on the people aspiring after the DPRK and calling for reunification through alliance with the north.
					
					Last year they branded more than 90 Internet websites as "pro-north websites" and cut off their connection as well as deleting over 80 000 notices and detained and inflicted penalties upon those related.

articles.title: Probe into Truth about Cyber Attacks Urged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Probe into Truth about Cyber Attacks Urged in S. Korea
Pyongyang, January 13 (KCNA) -- Students of south Korea have strongly urged a probe into the case of cyber terrorism by the "Grand National Party".
					More than 10 universities, including Seoul National University and Yonsei University, launched a campaign of declaration on situation in demand of direct explanation from Lee Myung Bak over the case of Ddos attacks on the homepage of the Central Election Commission.
					
					The General Student Council of Korea University urged a special inspection system to probe the truth behind the case.
					
					The General Student Council of Seoul National University called a press conference on Wednesday, stating it has been disclosed that Chongwadae was deeply involved in the case.
					
					The organization demanded severe punishment of all those of the ruling GNP responsible for the case.
					
					If the Lee Myung Bak "government" tries to hush up the case, the anger of the April 19 uprising will sweep over the streets again, it warned.

articles.title: Mongolia Opposes Isolation of DPRK: Official
articles.content:
Mongolia Opposes Isolation of DPRK: Official
Pyongyang, January 13 (KCNA) -- The Mongolian defense minister on Wednesday voiced his government's opposition to politically and diplomatically isolating the Democratic People's Republic of Korea in the international community over the country's nuclear issue, according to Russia's ITAR TASS.
					"The DPRK nuclear issue draws particular attention. But, it is very important not to make the country isolated," he said.

articles.title: Memorial Services for Kim Jong Il Held Abroad
articles.content:
Memorial Services for Kim Jong Il Held Abroad
Pyongyang, January 13 (KCNA) -- Memorial services took place in Nepal, Sri Lanka and Pakistan between Dec. 29 last year and Jan. 2 this year on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					Attending the services were personages of the Central Committee of the Nepal Worker-Peasant Party and a regional committee under the party, the Sri Lanka-People's Korea Friendship Association, the Pakistani Organization for the Study of the Juche Idea and the Committee for Women's Rights of Pakistan and the Asian Regional Institute of the Juche Idea and masses.
					
					They paid silent tribute to Kim Jong Il. 
					
					Prasad Kafrel, member of the C. C., the Nepal Worker-Peasant Party, said that Kim Jong Il wisely led socialism in the DPRK so that it could dynamically advance despite the moves of the imperialist forces to stifle it and their military threat and economic sanctions, adding that his noble exploits would last forever.
					
					Prof. Ratune Sekura of Sri Lanka noted that Kim Jong Il defended socialism and global peace and resolutely foiled the provocations and arbitrary practices of the imperialists, holding aloft the banner of the Juche idea and the Songun idea, and positively helped the people of developing countries in their struggle.
					
					Berkat Ullah, chairman of the Pakistani Organization for the Study of the Juche Idea, and other speakers expressed belief that the Korean people would overcome their sorrow as early as possible and surely accomplish the cause of Kim Jong Il under the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Korean People's Struggle for National Reunification Supported
articles.content:
Korean People's Struggle for National Reunification Supported
Pyongyang, January 13 (KCNA) -- Organizations of Democratic Congo and Peru released statements on Jan. 6 in support of the joint New Year editorial of the DPRK.
					The Working Citizens' Association of Democratic Congo said in its statement that the world was deeply moved to see the party, army and people of the DPRK overwhelmed with irrepressible grief over the demise of the great leader.
					
					It continued:
					
					The association is convinced that the Korean people will show the world that they are steadfastly carrying forward the revolutionary cause of Juche under the leadership of HE Kim Jong Un, their supreme leader, on the occasion of the centenary of birth of the great President Kim Il Sung.
					
					The association will further intensify the activities for friendship and solidarity with the Korean people.
					
					Our association remains unchanged in its stand of supporting the Korean people in their cause of achieving the reunification of the country in an independent and peaceful way, guided by the spirit of the three charters for national reunification and the June 15 joint declaration.
					
					We will let the people of Democratic Congo clearly know about the reality of the DPRK with a view to building up strong public opinion supporting the efforts of the DPRK to accelerate reunification by the concerted strength of all the Koreans in the north and the south and overseas.
					
					The Peruvian Preparatory Committee to Commemorate the Centenary of Birth of President Kim Il Sung in its statement expressed belief that the Korean people would achieve greater success in their drive for the economic development and independent and peaceful reunification of the country true to the wise leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un and the Songun politics.

articles.title: CPLA General Staff Issues Order on Military Drills This Year
articles.content:
CPLA General Staff Issues Order on Military Drills This Year
Beijing, January 12 (KCNA) -- The General Staff of the Chinese People's Liberation Army recently issued an order on military drills for the new year.
					The order underlined the need to bring about renovation in the training, put stress on joint exercises, strengthen the drills of branches of arms and raise the quality of military academies during the new year's military drills.
					
					It also called on the entire army and the armed police units to implement the important strategy and idea of President Hu Jintao on national defense and army building and bring about turn in the military trainings and thus greet the 18th Congress of the Communist Party of China with good results.

articles.title: China Rejects U.S. Accusation: FM Spokesman
articles.content:
China Rejects U.S. Accusation: FM Spokesman
Beijing, January 12 (KCNA) -- Chinese Foreign Ministry Spokesman Liu Weimin at a regular press conference Wednesday, refuted accusations that China has stolen jobs from the United States and that the country has shown "disrespect for human rights."
					China opposes the groundless criticisms voiced by some candidates running in the U.S. Republican Party Primary Election, Liu said.
					
					"Accusing China will be of no use in dealing with domestic problems in the U.S.," Liu said, adding that it also won't help a Republican candidate win the election.

articles.title: China Calls for Resolving Iran's Nuclear Issue
articles.content:
China Calls for Resolving Iran's Nuclear Issue
Beijing, January 12 (KCNA) -- Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman Liu Weimin called for resolving Iran's nuclear issue at a press conference on Wednesday.
					The priority for resolving Iran's nuclear issue is to resume dialogue and negotiations between Iran and nations concerned immediately and make efforts for a comprehensive, long-term and proper resolution for this issue, Liu said.

articles.title: China-U.S. Confrontation Will Become Acute: Expert
articles.content:
China-U.S. Confrontation Will Become Acute: Expert
Moscow, January 12 (KCNA) -- A Russian economic expert recently predicted that the confrontation between China and the U.S. will become acute. 
					Speaking to Voice of Russia, Alexei Maslov said China stated the U.S. attempt to strengthen its military presence in Asia cannot be allowed, while opposing sanctions against Iran's oil. 
					
					The fact shows that China is standing against the U.S. trying to increase its influence in Asia, he said. China is likely to try to drive the U.S. out of Asia and control its action in the Persian Gulf.

articles.title: Expressways under Construction in Liaoning Province, China
articles.content:
Expressways under Construction in Liaoning Province, China
Beijing, January 12 (KCNA) -- Liaoning Province, China, is paying much effort to the construction of expressways.
					Last year, the province built an expressway extending 3 300 kilometers.
					
					It plans to construct another 3 900-kilometer-long expressway this year.

articles.title: Russia Calls for Dialogue on Iran Nuclear Issue
articles.content:
Russia Calls for Dialogue on Iran Nuclear Issue
Moscow, January 12 (KCNA) -- Russian Deputy Foreign Minister Sergei Ryabkov on Wednesday called on Iran and other concerned parties to resolve the Iran nuclear issue by dialogues.
					Ryabkov told the state-owned Itar-Tass news agency that Iran and the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) should exert more efforts to solve the issue by dialogues and cooperation.
					
					Ryabkov also urged Iran and Western countries to refrain from statements and actions that could aggravate the situation in the Strait of Hormuz.
					
					In addition, the official stressed that Russia rejects oil sanctions against Iran, as the new sanctions would not strengthen the nuclear non-proliferation.

articles.title: Venezuelan President Blasts U.S. Attitude towards Iranian President's Visit to His Country
articles.content:
Venezuelan President Blasts U.S. Attitude towards Iranian President's Visit to His Country
Pyongyang, January 13 (KCNA) -- Venezuelan President Hugo Chavez exposed the nature of the United States which dislikes the development of relations between his country and Iran.
					Speaking during a joint press conference with his Iranian counterpart on Monday, Chavez said that the U.S. was unhappy with Ahmadinejad's visit to Venezuela because Washington was scared of spread of Iran's ideas and ideals across the world.
					
					He said hegemonic powers worried that the joint voices of Iran and Venezuela which echo freedom, honor and justice will shake the columns of their dominance.

articles.title: Brazilian President on His Country's Economic Development
articles.content:
Brazilian President on His Country's Economic Development
Pyongyang, January 13 (KCNA) -- Brazilian President Dilma Vana Rousseff made remarks on the issue of the economic development of the country, when interviewed by a TV broadcasting service on Jan. 8.
					She said the country created 2 million jobs, achieved economic growth and edged down the rate of the inflation despite the world-wide economic depression last year.
					
					She assured the people that her government would take steps to further improve the economic performance this year, too.

articles.title: Iran Dismisses West's "Concern"
articles.content:
Iran Dismisses West's "Concern"
Pyongyang, January 13 (KCNA) -- The Iranian permanent representative at the International Atomic Energy Agency, when interviewed by a news agency on Jan. 10, dismissed the West's "concern" over Iran's nuclear activities. 
					Accusing the West of slinging mud at Iran with "concern" about the start of uranium enrichment at an underground bunker built in Qom City, he termed this "concern" politically-motivated.
					
					Iran had already declared a plan to build underground nuclear facilities two years ago, he said, adding that Iran's nuclear activities are of peaceful nature and, therefore, they are not contrary to international law.

articles.title: Malaysian FM Refers on Foreign Policy of His Government
articles.content:
Malaysian FM Refers on Foreign Policy of His Government
Pyongyang, January 13 (KCNA) -- Malaysian Foreign Minister Datuk Anifah Aman in a recent speech clarified the government's stand on foreign policy.
					The government will pursue the foreign policy to further develop the friendly relations and form strategic partnership with other countries this year in the direction of realizing the goal to build a developed country till 2020, he said.
					
					The government will concentrate efforts on the economic diplomacy with a main stress put on increase of trade and investment and invariably give priority to the development of relations with neighboring countries, he added.

articles.title: Iran Strongly Reacts to U.S. and West's Sanctions
articles.content:
Iran Strongly Reacts to U.S. and West's Sanctions
Pyongyang, January 13 (KCNA) -- The Iranian government and people are standing firm against the persistent politico-military threats and sanctions by the U.S., Israel and the West.
					Iranian President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad struck out at the U.S. and other Western powers for working hard to disturb his country's development of nuclear science and technology.
					
					He also clarified more than once the country's stance not to forfeit its right to develop nuclear energy for peaceful purposes. 
					
					The minister of Defense and Armed Forces Logistics accused the American government mired in an impasse at present of resorting to a smear campaign to divert elsewhere the domestic criticism.
					
					He voiced his stand to beat back any military invasion and firmly defend the interests of the country.
					
					The vice-chairman of the National Security and Foreign Policy Committee of the Iranian Majlis warned the U.S. and other Western powers that Iran will blockade the Strait of Hormuz if they put embargo on Iran's oil exports.
					
					Iran is registering successes by channeling sustained big efforts into bolstering its defence capability to cope with the enemies' moves for aggression.
					
					Iranian experts have finished the designing for the latest anti-air missile defense system "Babar 373" by their own efforts.
					
					"Sair" anti-aircraft artillery pieces capable of detecting and intercepting air targets through a radar and optical system as well as striking marine targets were inducted into the Islamic Revolution Guards Corps of Iran. 
					
					Three 120 ton-class "Gadir" submarines were inducted into the Iranian navy. 
					
					A plan was announced to build an aircraft carrier and the second modern destroyer called "Zamaran 2". 
					
					As a strong counter-action against the U.S. and other Western powers' sanctions, the navy staged 10-day Velayat-90 military exercises in the Hormuz Strait from Dec. 24 last year.

articles.title: Ortega Reelected Nicaraguan President
articles.content:
Ortega Reelected Nicaraguan President
Pyongyang, January 13 (KCNA) -- Daniel Ortega Saavedra was reelected president of Nicaragua.
					On Tuesday, he was sworn in office at Managua's Revolution Square crowded with some 8 000 citizens.

articles.title: 4 Killed in U.S. Drone Strike in NW Pakistan
articles.content:
4 Killed in U.S. Drone Strike in NW Pakistan
Pyongyang, January 13 (KCNA) -- The U.S. forces in Afghanistan have continued to make air strikes on Pakistan in the new year, too, under the signboard of "anti-terrorism".
					At least four people were killed as U.S. drones fired two missiles at a house in Miranshah in Pakistan's northwest tribal area of North Waziristan early on Wednesday morning, reported by local media Geo.
					
					Several others were also injured in the strike.

articles.title: U.S. Takes Wrong Way: Poll
articles.content:
U.S. Takes Wrong Way: Poll
Pyongyang, January 13 (KCNA) -- Public criticism of the government's wrong policy is growing in the United States.
					According to the results of a poll carried out by UPI throughout the country on Tuesday, 64 percent of the respondents answered that the United States is taking a wrong way.

articles.title: U.S. Ex-servicepersons Suffer Difficulty of Finding Employment
articles.content:
U.S. Ex-servicepersons Suffer Difficulty of Finding Employment
Pyongyang, January 13 (KCNA) -- Ex-servicepersons find it difficult to get jobs in the United States.
					An official announcement of the U.S. government revealed that more than 850 000 of those who returned from the Iraqi and Afghan wars are jobless.
					
					In the United States 15 percent of the homeless are ex-servicepersons, according to a research institution.

articles.title: EU Unemployment Hits Record High
articles.content:
EU Unemployment Hits Record High
Pyongyang, January 13 (KCNA) -- Unemployment in the European Union (EU) has reached a historically high level of 9.8 percent, according to the latest quarterly report released on Tuesday by the European Commission.
					Youth unemployment reached 5.6 million in November 2011, also bringing the rate to a new high of 22.3 percent from about 15 percent in spring 2008, according to the report.

articles.title: Fire Incidents Up in Japan
articles.content:
Fire Incidents Up in Japan
Pyongyang, January 13 (KCNA) -- The number of fire incidents increases in Japan, a media report said.
					The government said on Tuesday that there were 27 557 incidents in the country in the first half of 2011, rising 12 percent from the year earlier.
					
					The number of people killed in fires is 1 045.

articles.title: Bushfire in Australia
articles.content:
Bushfire in Australia
Pyongyang, January 13 (KCNA) -- A bushfire in Western Australia's northwest is still burning and the fire intensity has increased, a media report said. 
					The fire had burnt through more than 286 000 hectares until Wednesday.

articles.title: Quake Hits Solomon Islands
articles.content:
Quake Hits Solomon Islands
Pyongyang, January 13 (KCNA) -- An earthquake occurred in the Solomon Islands on Monday, a media report said.
					The quake measured 6.6 magnitude.

articles.title: Number of Suicides Increases in Japan
articles.content:
Number of Suicides Increases in Japan
Pyongyang, January 13 (KCNA) -- The number of people who commit suicide continues to increase in Japan.
					The number of suicides in 2011 stood at 30 513, surpassing 30 000 for the 14th straight year, the National Police Agency said Tuesday in a preliminary report.

articles.title: Italian Demonstrators Demand Public Safety
articles.content:
Italian Demonstrators Demand Public Safety
Pyongyang, January 13 (KCNA) -- Thousands of people demonstrated in Rome and Milan, Italy, on Tuesday demanding public safety, a media report said.
					They, marching through the streets, strongly urged the government to immediately take measures for preventing homicides prevailing in the country.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim aboga por aumentar produccion de carbon
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim aboga por aumentar produccion de carbon
Pyongyang, 13 de enero (ACNC) -- El premier coreano Choe Yong Rim averiguo en el terreno el dia 11 el estado de produccion de la Mina de Carbon de Jenam del Complejo Carbonifero de la Zona de Tokchon, la cual se ha incorporado a la labor para incrementar la produccion carbonifera en pleno acato a las consignas conjuntas del Comite Central y la Comision Militar Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y al editorial conjunto publicado por el Ano Nuevo y en respuesta a la carta de los trabajadores de la provincia de Hamgyong del Sur.
					En la galeria de extraccion no.2, Choe estimulo a los carboneros que estan registrando innovaciones en la produccion y averiguo detalladamente los problemas que se surgen en la galeria.
					
					Luego, convoco la reunion consultiva de los funcionarios correspondientes para proveer en cantidades suficientes ese combustible fosil que hace mucha falta en varios dominios de la economia nacional.
					
					Se abordaron en la ocasion varios problemas tales como concentrar las fuerzas principales en anteponer la perforacion como ya habia indicado el partido para incrementar la produccion de carbon, y normalizar la produccion de carbon aumentar el numero de las galerias de reserva, en particular, las de buenas perspectivas de produccion.
					
					Se tomaron concretas medidas de trabajo que exigen al sector de industria electrica suministrar sin apagon la electricidad necesaria a la produccion hullera y a los dominios de selvicultura y transporte ferroviario resolver con preferencia los problemas vinculados con la produccion de la madera de entibacion y su transporte.
					
					Igualmente, fue tratado el problema de mejorar el servicio de intendencia y abastecimiento para los carboneros.
					
					Ademas, en la reunion, el premier exhorto a todos los presentes a contribuir a la construccion de una patria prospera con el incremento de produccion hullera en pleno acato al legado del Dirigente Kim Jong Il y bajo la orientacion del Maximo Dirigente del partido, el Estado y el Ejercito, Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: CRPP publica carta blanca de los crimenes de banda de Lee Myung Bak
articles.content:
CRPP publica carta blanca de los crimenes de banda de Lee Myung Bak
Pyongyang, 13 de enero (ACNC) -- El Secretariado del Comite por la Reunificacion Pacifica de la Patria (CRPP) hizo publica el dia 12 una carta blanca para revelar los crimenes del ano pasado de Lee Myung Bak, que llevaron al extremo las relaciones Norte-Sur de Corea, de entre otros delitos cometidos por el en los 4 anos de su mandato.
					El texto resumido de la nota sigue:
					
					La camarilla de Lee Myung Bak rehuso totalmente la propuesta de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea sobre el dialogo intercoreano.
					
					El 5 de enero del ano expirado, el gobierno, los partidos politicos y las entidades de la RPDC publicaron una declaracion conjunta proponiendo a sus homologos surcoreanos el dialogo y negociaciones multilaterales.
					
					Pero, las autoridades surcoreanas calumniaron la iniciativa diciendo que "es carente de sinceridad" y "una tactica de frente unido" y la rechazaron frontalmente poniendo condiciones injustas tales como "cancelacion de arma nuclear", el caso de hundimiento de la corbeta "Cheonan" y el "de canonazo en la isla Yonphyong".
					
					Para colmo, se atrevieron a cuestionar la autoridad de la contraparte del dialogo.
					
					Cuando acudieron a desganas a las conversaciones militares previas, complicaron esta cita planteando obstinadamente los dos casos ya referidos y cometieron la canallada de retirarse unilateralmente.
					
					Abortaron las conversaciones y el contacto de cruz roja para solucionar asuntos humanitarios entre ambas partes coreanas y hasta el dialogo de nivel civil.
					
					Como resultado, quedaron suspendidas todas las labores de la cooperacion N-S y se dieron en bancarrota o en la crisis de cierre muchas empresas civiles del Sur de Corea. Y un gran numero de surcoreanos, que se sustentaban de la cooperacion N-S, se vieron en la encrucijada de vida o muerte.
					
					Las autoridades surcoreanas impidieron tambien la celebracion de los actos nacionales conjuntos que habian sido programados con motivo de los dias de publicacion de las historicas declaraciones intercoreanas.
					
					No permitieron al Consejo por la Solucion del Problema de las Tropas de Voluntarios sostener comunicacion con la parte nortena para discutir el texto de la declaracion conjunta de las entidades de mujeres del Norte y el Sur de Corea a publicar con motivo del dia conmemorativo del Levantamiento Popular del Primero de Marzo.
					
					Desautorizaron tambien el viaje a Kaesong de los miembros de la comision funeraria de Pak Yong Gil, viuda del pastor surcoreano Mun Ik Hwan, para recibir la nota de condolencias de la parte Norte.
					
					La banda de Lee recurrio con mas frenesi a la campana de confrontacion fratricida y al complot anti-RPDC.
					
					Solo en el ano pasado, Lee visito varias veces a EE.UU. en busca de apoyo a su politica de enfrentamiento fratricida y chismeo abiertamente que "no cambiara su politica sobre el Norte aunque sea criticada dentro y fuera del pais". 
					
					Los titeres surcoreanos mantuvieron tras las rejas por mas de un ano al pastor Han Sang Ryol quien fue condenado luego a duras penas en virtud de la infame "ley de seguridad" por el solo hecho de haber visitado a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					
					Reprimieron la Solidaridad de los Jovenes y Estudiantes para la Ejecucion de la Declaracion Conjunta del 15 de Junio y otras entidades calificandolas de "pro-enemigas". 
					
					El ano pasado, desconectaron mas de 90 sitios web tildandolos de "pro-Norte" y eliminaron mas de 80 y tantos mil articulos online, ademas de arrestar y encarcelar a sus autores y divulgadores. 
					
					Inventaron sucesivamente los casos intrigantes como el de la red de espias y el del grupo de sicarios, aumentando cada vez mas el clima de enfrentamiento. 
					
					La campana conflictiva anti-RPDC de la banda del traidor Lee llego al climax en el periodo de duelo nacional a finales del ano pasado. 
					
					Tan pronto como fue publicada la informacion sobre el duelo nacional, convoco la "reunion de seguridad nacional" y el "consejo de ministros" y ordeno a Chongwadae (Casa Azul), el ejecutivo, el ejercito titere y la policia el "estado de alerta" y el "estado de servicio emergente" para que apuntaran los fusiles en los enlutados connacionales del Norte. 
					
					Pretendio al mismo tiempo destruir la unidad monolitica de la RPDC hablando de la "reaccion diferenciada a la direccion y a los habitantes del Norte". 
					
					Las autoridades y la chusma del "Gran Partido Nacional" del Sur de Corea insultaron siniestramente la manera de expresar condolencias de los habitantes norcoreanos e impidieron la visita de condolencias de los partidos opositores y las entidades de distintos sectores. 
					
					Reprimieron brutalmente a los jovenes, estudiantes y entidades civiles surcoreanos que quisieron expresar condolencias en los altares de incensacion acondicionados por ellos mismos. 
					
					En el dia de despedida del Dirigente Kim Jong Il, cometieron la imperdonable provocacion de enviar mas de 30 entidades conservadoras y derechistas a la linea de demarcacion militar para que lanzaran los volantes de contenido anti-RPDC que manchaban la maxima dignidad de la RPDC y agitaban la insurreccion. 
					
					La banda de traidores surcoreanos recrudecio el ano pasado sus acciones belicas. 
					
					Amenazaron seriamente la paz y la estabilidad de la Peninsula Coreana y la region al crear la crisis de conflicto armado Norte-Sur. 
					
					Cometio incesantemente las provocaciones de una magnitud sin precedentes insultando atrevidamente la maxima dignidad de la RPDC. 
					
					De verdad, la camarilla del traidor Lee Myung Bak es la horda de peores maniacos de enfrentamiento y guerra que sera condenada implacablemente.

articles.title: Ministro de Defensa de Mongolia se opone a aislamiento de Corea
articles.content:
Ministro de Defensa de Mongolia se opone a aislamiento de Corea
Pyongyang, 13 de enero (ACNC) -- Segun ITAR-TASS de Rusia, el dia 11, el ministro de Defensa de Mongolia senalo que el gobierno mongol se opone al aislamiento politico-diplomatico contra la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea en el escenario internacional en cuanto al problema nuclear.
					Hizo hincapie en que el problema nuclear de la RPDC causa la atencion peculiar, pero es muy importante no aislarla.
